intro: Cryptantha similis, commonly known as the slender cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are clustered in dense racemes. Cryptantha similis is often found in regions with Mediterranean climates, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
